stork.feather

Class Bell.Promise

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Bell<T>
      • stork.feather.Bell.Promise
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future<T>
    Enclosing class:
    Bell<T>

    public class Bell.Promise
extends Bell<T>
    A bell which is promised to the parent bell on instantiation. This may optionally be created with a delegate bell that will be rung with the result of the parent bell if no handler is defined in this bell. If a handler is overridden in this bell, it is up to the handler to ring the delegated bell or promise it to a bell which will ultimately ring it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class stork.feather.Bell

        Bell.All<V>, Bell.And, Bell.Any<V>, Bell.MultiBell<I>, Bell.Or, Bell.Promise, Bell.PromiseAs<V>, Bell.Then, Bell.ThenAs<V>

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bell.Promise

        public Bell.Promise()
        Create a promise which does not delegate to any other bell.

      • Bell.Promise

        public Bell.Promise(Bell<? super T> delegate)
        Create a promise which delegates to the given bell if none of the handlers are redefined. This allows you to essentially insert shims between two bells, or create a chain where a failure in any bell immediately rings the final bell.
        Parameters:
        delegate - the bell to delegate to if no handler is defined.

    • Method Detail

      • done

        public void done(T t)
        Description copied from class: Bell
        This handler is called when the bell has rung and is passed the rung value. Subclasses can override this to do something when the bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you want to see the value.
        Overrides:
        done in class Bell<T>

      • fail

        public void fail(Throwable t)
        Description copied from class: Bell
        This handler is called when the bell has rung with an exception, and is passed the exception. Subclasses can override this to do something when the bell has been rung. These will be run before waiting threads are notified. Any exceptions thrown will be discarded. Implement this if you want to see the error.
        Overrides:
        fail in class Bell<T>
